io.github.dialogsforandroid

Class MaterialDialog.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.dialogsforandroid.MaterialDialog.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    MaterialDialog

    public static class MaterialDialog.Builder
extends Object
    The class used to construct a MaterialDialog.

      • typeface

        public MaterialDialog.Builder typeface(android.graphics.Typeface medium,
                                       android.graphics.Typeface regular)
        Sets the fonts used in the dialog. It's recommended that you use typeface(String, String) instead, to avoid duplicate Typeface allocations and high memory usage.
        Parameters:
        medium - The font used on titles and action buttons. Null uses device default.
        regular - The font used everywhere else, like on the content and list items. Null uses device default.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • typeface

        public MaterialDialog.Builder typeface(String medium,
                                       String regular)
        Sets the fonts used in the dialog, by file names. This also uses TypefaceHelper in order to avoid any un-needed allocations (it recycles typefaces for you).
        Parameters:
        medium - The name of font in assets/fonts used on titles and action buttons (null uses device default). E.g. [your-project]/app/main/assets/fonts/[medium]
        regular - The name of font in assets/fonts used everywhere else, like content and list items (null uses device default). E.g. [your-project]/app/main/assets/fonts/[regular]
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • itemsCallbackSingleChoice

        public MaterialDialog.Builder itemsCallbackSingleChoice(int selectedIndex,
                                                        MaterialDialog.ListCallbackSingleChoice callback)
        Pass anything below 0 (such as -1) for the selected index to leave all options unselected initially. Otherwise pass the index of an item that will be selected initially.
        Parameters:
        selectedIndex - The checkbox index that will be selected initially.
        callback - The callback that will be called when the presses the positive button.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • alwaysCallSingleChoiceCallback

        public MaterialDialog.Builder alwaysCallSingleChoiceCallback()
        By default, the single choice callback is only called when the user clicks the positive button or if there are no buttons. Call this to force it to always call on item clicks even if the positive button exists.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • itemsCallbackMultiChoice

        public MaterialDialog.Builder itemsCallbackMultiChoice(Integer[] selectedIndices,
                                                       MaterialDialog.ListCallbackMultiChoice callback)
        Pass null for the selected indices to leave all options unselected initially. Otherwise pass an array of indices that will be selected initially.
        Parameters:
        selectedIndices - The radio button indices that will be selected initially.
        callback - The callback that will be called when the presses the positive button.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • itemsDisabledIndices

        public MaterialDialog.Builder itemsDisabledIndices(Integer... disabledIndices)
        Sets indices of items that are not clickable. If they are checkboxes or radio buttons, they will not be toggleable.
        Parameters:
        disabledIndices - The item indices that will be disabled from selection.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • alwaysCallMultiChoiceCallback

        public MaterialDialog.Builder alwaysCallMultiChoiceCallback()
        By default, the multi choice callback is only called when the user clicks the positive button or if there are no buttons. Call this to force it to always call on item clicks even if the positive button exists.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • btnStackedGravity

        public MaterialDialog.Builder btnStackedGravity(GravityEnum gravity)
        Sets the gravity used for the text in stacked action buttons. By default, it's #GravityEnum.END.
        Parameters:
        gravity - The gravity to use.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so calls can be chained.

      • progress

        public MaterialDialog.Builder progress(boolean indeterminate,
                                       int max)
        Makes this dialog a progress dialog.
        Parameters:
        indeterminate - If true, an infinite circular spinner is shown. If false, a horizontal progress bar is shown that is incremented or set via the built MaterialDialog instance. The style (horizontal/circular) can be overridden using progressHorizontal(boolean)
        max - When indeterminate is false, the max value the horizontal progress bar can get to.
        Returns:
        An instance of the Builder so calls can be chained.

      • progress

        public MaterialDialog.Builder progress(boolean indeterminate,
                                       int max,
                                       boolean showMinMax)
        Makes this dialog a progress dialog.
        Parameters:
        indeterminate - If true, an infinite circular spinner is shown. If false, a horizontal progress bar is shown that is incremented or set via the built MaterialDialog instance.
        max - When indeterminate is false, the max value the horizontal progress bar can get to.
        showMinMax - For determinate dialogs, the min and max will be displayed to the left (start) of the progress bar, e.g. 50/100.
        Returns:
        An instance of the Builder so calls can be chained.

      • progressNumberFormat

        public MaterialDialog.Builder progressNumberFormat(String format)
        hange the format of the small text showing current and maximum units of progress. The default is "%1d/%2d".

      • progressPercentFormat

        public MaterialDialog.Builder progressPercentFormat(NumberFormat format)
        Change the format of the small text showing the percentage of progress. The default is NumberFormat.getPercentageInstance().

      • progressHorizontal

        public MaterialDialog.Builder progressHorizontal(boolean horizontal)
        By default, indeterminate progress dialogs will use a circular indicator and determinate progress dialogs will use a horizontal indicator. Both defaults can be overridden here.

      • autoDismiss

        public MaterialDialog.Builder autoDismiss(boolean dismiss)
        This defaults to true. If set to false, the dialog will not automatically be dismissed when an action button is pressed, and not automatically dismissed when the user selects a list item.
        Parameters:
        dismiss - Whether or not to dismiss the dialog automatically.
        Returns:
        The Builder instance so you can chain calls to it.

      • adapter

        public MaterialDialog.Builder adapter(<any> adapter,
                                      RecyclerView.LayoutManager layoutManager)
        Sets a custom android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter for the dialog's list
        Parameters:
        adapter - The adapter to set to the list.
        layoutManager - The layout manager to use in the RecyclerView. Pass null to use the default linear manager.
        Returns:
        This Builder object to allow for chaining of calls to set methods

      • limitIconToDefaultSize

        public MaterialDialog.Builder limitIconToDefaultSize()
        Limits the display size of a set icon to 48dp.

      • inputRangeRes

                                            int errorColor)
